title: Quiz 3: Cardiovascular Diseases
description: Evaluate your knowledge on heart disorders, symptoms like angina, and prevention strategies.

questions.question: Match the specific Cardiovascular Disease to its definition:

pairs.right: Affects blood vessels supplying the heart
Affects brain blood vessels (leads to stroke)
Damage from rheumatic fever affecting valves

questions.hint: Look at the root words: 'Coronary' relates to the heart, 'Cerebro' to the brain.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common symptom of a cardiovascular event (heart attack)?
questions.explanation: Signs include chest pain/pressure, shortness of breath, nausea, and cold sweats.
questions.hint: The symptom is localized to the chest area.

questions.question: Which of the following are prevention and control strategies for CVDs? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Strategies include quitting smoking, exercising, reducing salt/fats, and managing stress.
questions.hint: Healthy lifestyle choices prevent heart disease. Saturated fats are bad for the heart.

questions.question: What is the specific type of CVD caused by structural defects present at birth?
questions.explanation: Congenital heart disease refers to structural defects present at birth.

questions.question: Cardiovascular diseases are always symptomatic, meaning a patient will always feel pain before a severe event.
questions.explanation: CVDs are sometimes asymptomatic until a severe event like a heart attack or stroke occurs.

questions.question: Deep vein thrombosis results in blood clots in the ___BLANK___ veins, which can move to the lungs causing ___BLANK___ embolism.
questions.explanation: DVT occurs in leg veins; clots moving to lungs cause pulmonary embolism.
questions.hint: The first blank is a limb; the second refers to the lungs.

questions.question: What is 'Angina'?

options.text: Chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart
A blood clot in the brain

questions.explanation: Coronary heart disease causes angina (chest pain) and heart attacks.
questions.hint: It is a symptom associated with coronary heart disease.

questions.question: Order the general progression of CVD development based on risk factors:

richContent.content: Disease Pathway: From lifestyle to event.

questions.explanation: Lifestyle leads to metabolic changes, causing physical blockages, resulting in acute events.
questions.hint: Start with behavior and end with the emergency event.

questions.question: Which of the following diets is specifically mentioned as beneficial for CVD prevention?
questions.explanation: The text mentions a healthy diet like the Mediterranean diet.
questions.hint: Named after a sea region known for olive oil and fish consumption.

questions.question: Which underlying conditions are listed as causes/risk factors for CVDs? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Diabetes, hypertension, and high cholesterol are key underlying conditions for CVD.
questions.hint: Asthma is a respiratory disease, not a direct cause of CVD like the others.
